page.title: 11CHRISTIANITY IN SWANMORE
page.content: {St. Barnabas' Church}is the Church of England in Swanmore. It was built in 1844. Mr. Peterson, the vicar, retired on Sunday 23rd June, l985. He had been our Vicar for twenty-three years. Rev. Michael Welch from Portsmouth has been appointed to this Parish from Autumn l985. The Church has six bells. These are made from cast iron and each one is a different size and has a different tone. {The Methodist Chapel}was built in 1863. Mr. Barrat, the minister, has been a minister for thirty-seven years and he is going to retire in August, 1985. Mr. Barrat was ordained in South Africa. The Swanmore Chapel has no bells or tower. We found that in Swanmore Primary School most children go to the Church of England, only two go to the R.C. church in Bishop's Waltham and 24 to the Methodist Chapel
